clinical_study.brief_title: PoC-HCV Genedrive Viral Detection Assay Validation Study

lead_sponsor.agency: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

clinical_study.source: French National Institute for Health and Medical Research-French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis (Inserm-ANRS)

brief_summary.textblock: The principal objective is to assess the diagnostic accuracy of the PoC assay (Genedrive, Epistem) to detect HCV RNA against the reference standard of commercial real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) assay (RealTime HCV, Abbott) using stored heparinized plasma from patients with chronic hepatitis C and non-infected controls.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of HCV RNA detection with PoC assay (Genedrive, Epistem) vs reference standard of commercial real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) assay (RealTime HCV, Abbott).
primary_outcome.description: Assess the diagnostic accuracy of the PoC assay (Genedrive, Epistem) to detect HCV RNA against the reference standard of commercial real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) assay (RealTime HCV, Abbott) using stored heparinized plasma from patients with chronic hepatitis C and non-infected controls (with Genedrive channel acceptance set at 2 out of 3).

secondary_outcome.description: To optimize the diagnostic algorithm (i.e., 1, 2, or 3 out of 3 channels; repeat testing or not) that gives the optimal balance between sensitivity and specificity for detection of HCV RNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors associated with false-positive of false-negative results
secondary_outcome.description: To identify factors associated with false-positive or false-negative results of the PoC assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the inter-examiner reproducibility of the PoC assay.

intervention.intervention_name: HCV RNA detection with Genedrive assay
intervention.other_name: HCV RNA detection with Point of Care assay

intervention.intervention_name: HCV RNA detection with RealTime HCV
intervention.other_name: HCV RNA detection with RT-PCR assay

study_pop.textblock:
Pre-treatment cohort: 228 HCV patients samples
- Age > 18 years old.
- Patients with positive HCV RNA.
- Heparinized plasma samples are available before the initiation of antiviral HCV therapy.
- Patients have given a written consent that their blood samples will be further used for research.
Control samples : 189 controls
- Age > 18 years old.
- Participants were tested negative for anti-HCV antibody
- Heparinized plasma samples are available
- Participants have given a written consent that their blood samples will be further used for research
